main event: On September 8, 1960, multiple witnesses in Hartford, Connecticut, observed an unidentified flying object described as a bright light moving in the sky, which was later classified as unidentified.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for different durations, between 3-5 minutes, with some witnesses describing the object as emitting a bright white light without any noise., A woman reported seeing a small creature in connection with the sighting., Investigations conducted by the Air Force did not yield any definitive conclusions regarding the object's nature, leading to classifications of multiple reports as 'unidentified.', The Hartford Police Department received multiple calls from residents who witnessed the object at nearly the same time., Investigators noted that one object was described as being approximately 50-60 feet in diameter, which remained stationary for a considerable duration before quickly departing.
sighted object: a bright, luminous object in the sky
witness description: Residents of Hartford, including Mr. John Doe, Mrs. Mary Jones, and Mr. William F. Klein, who reported seeing the object under clear sky conditions at night.
